Module stormpot
Package stormpot

Class PoolException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • stormpot.PoolException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class PoolException
extends java.lang.RuntimeException

    The PoolException may be thrown by a pool implementation in a number of circumstances:

    • If claim is called and the pool needs to allocate a new object, but the allocation fails by returning null or throwing an exception.

    • Likewise if the Reallocator.reallocate(Slot, Poolable) method return null or throw an exception.

    • If the Slot.release(Poolable) method is misused, and the pool is able to detect this.

    • If the expiration check throws an exception.

    Author:
    Chris Vest <mr.chrisvest@gmail.com>
    See Also:
